snippet: A provision slipped into a 2014 spending law by the Florida senator has tangled up the Obama administration and sent tremors through health insurance markets.
abstract: Largely ignored provision included by Sen Marco Rubio in spending law in 2014 has rattled health insurance markets and raised questions about durability of Affordable Care Act, making Rubio sole Republican presidential candidate who has made progress on Republican goal of dismantling law; provision took aim at so-called risk corridors and limited amount of money government can use to protect insurance companies from financial losses, which has already led some insurers to shut down.
lead_paragraph: A provision slipped into a 2014 spending law by the Florida senator has tangled up the Obama administration and sent tremors through health insurance markets.

headline.main: Marco Rubio Quietly Undermines Affordable Care Act
headline.print_headline: Rubio Measure Delivers a Blow to Health Law

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
